summary: This is an email chain discussing the release of the DOJ's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) report on the Jeffrey Epstein case. It clarifies that the report was not officially released by the DOJ but was obtained by media outlets after being provided to Congress. The email references media coverage and a legal petition related to the report.

persons.name: Sasse
persons.context: Senator Sasse is mentioned as having pressed the Justice Department for over three years to investigate the handling of Epstein's charges and demanded the release of the OPR report.

events.title: DOJ Press Release on OPR Report
events.description: The DOJ issued a press release stating the Privacy Act prohibits public release of the full OPR report but permits disclosure to a congressional committee with jurisdiction.

events.title: Associated Press Obtains OPR Report
events.description: The Associated Press obtained and reported on the OPR report.

events.title: NBC News Obtains OPR Report
events.description: NBC News obtained and reported on the OPR report.

events.title: Multiple Media Outlets Report on OPR Report
events.description: ABC News, The Daily Beast, The New York Times, The Washington Post, the Miami Herald, and McClatchy obtained and reported on the OPR report.

events.title: CVRA Appellate Case Petition
events.description: A petition sought to supplement the 11th Circuit en banc rehearing record with the OPR report, but the court declined, limiting reconsideration to specific legal issues.

keyFacts: The DOJ's OPR report on the Epstein case was not officially released by the DOJ but was provided to Congress and subsequently obtained by multiple media outlets.
Senator Ben Sasse had pressed the DOJ for over three years to investigate the handling of Epstein's charges and demanded the report's release.
The DOJ cited the Privacy Act as prohibiting public release but allowed disclosure to a congressional committee, after which media outlets obtained it.
A legal petition to include the OPR report in an 11th Circuit en banc rehearing record was denied, as the court limited reconsideration to specific legal issues.
The email includes links to where the OPR report was posted online by media organizations.
